Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Carotid Endarterectomy and Carotid Artery Stenting on Dementia Risk in Asymptomatic Extracranial Carotid Artery Disease

Trial_Design.evidence: This retrospective cohort study utilized United States-based insurance claims data from 2010 to 2022

Intervention.evidence: patients undergoing CEA or CAS and those untreated

Objective.evidence: This study investigates the effects of carotid endarterectomy (CEA) and carotid artery stenting (CAS) on dementia incidence.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence of AD, measured over a mean follow-up of 8.34 years.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: The study was conducted without randomisation or blinding.

Blinding.evidence: The study was conducted without randomisation or blinding.

Number_Analysed.evidence: After matching, 37,317 patients underwent CEA or CAS.

Result_Outcome.evidence: CEA was associated with a significantly lower AD risk (relative risk = 0.93; 95% confidence interval, 0.86â€“0.99; P = 0.04)

Trial_Registration.evidence: The study was not registered as a clinical trial.
